intro: Racosperma lineatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant has slender, often hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. It produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are typical of the Acacia genus. Racosperma lineatum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy soils across the arid and semi-arid regions of Australia.
